title: 1954–55 Irish Cup
text:
The 1954–55 <a href="Irish%20Cup">Irish Cup</a> was the 75th edition of <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>'s premier <a href="Association%20football">football</a> knock-out cup competition. It began on 5 February 1955, and concluded on 23 April with the final.
The trophy was won by junior side <a href="Dundela%20F.C.">Dundela</a>, who pulled off one of the biggest shocks in Irish Cup history by defeating Irish League side <a href="Glenavon%20F.C.">Glenavon</a> in the final, who had already won three senior trophies that season: the <a href="City%20Cup%20%28Northern%20Ireland%29">City Cup</a>, <a href="Gold%20Cup%20%28Northern%20Ireland%29">Gold Cup</a> and <a href="Ulster%20Cup">Ulster Cup</a>. The defending champions were <a href="Derry%20City%20F.C.">Derry City</a>, who were defeated 3-2 in the first round by <a href="Linfield%20F.C.">Linfield</a>.
